Classes

class  ObjectListView
 An object list displays 'aspects' of a collection of objects in a multi-column list control. More...
class  ListViewNative
 Wrapper for all native method calls on ListView controls. More...
class  VirtualObjectListView
 A virtual object list view operates in virtual mode, that is, it only gets model objects for a row when it is needed. This gives it the ability to handle very large numbers of rows with minimal resources. More...
class  DataListView
 A DataListView is specialised to show the contents of a data source, which would normally be a DataTable or DataView. More...
class  OLVColumn
 An OLVColumn knows which aspect of an object it should present. More...
class  OLVListItem
class  OLVListSubItem
 A ListViewSubItem that knows which image should be drawn against it. More...
class  ListViewGroupComparer
class  ColumnComparer
 ColumnComparer is the workhorse for all comparison between two values of a particular column. If the column has a specific comparer, use that to compare the values. Otherwise, do a case insensitive string compare of the string representations of the values. More...
class  BaseRenderer
 Renderers are responsible for drawing a single cell within an owner drawn ObjectListView. More...
class  MappedImageRenderer
 This class maps a data value to an image that should be drawn for that value. More...
class  ImageRenderer
 Render an image that comes from our data source. More...
class  BarRenderer
 Render our Aspect as a progress bar. More...
class  MultiImageRenderer
 A MultiImageRenderer draws the same image a number of times based on our data value. More...

 These delegates are used to retrieve the object that is the key of the group to which the given row belongs.
